name: Paliperidone

dosing.adult_acute: Oral: 6 mg once daily in AM; LAI: 234 mg IM day 1, 156 mg IM day 8, then monthly
dosing.adult_maintenance: Oral: 3-12 mg/day; LAI monthly: 117-234 mg IM monthly; LAI q3mo: 273-819 mg IM every 3 months
dosing.notes: Active metabolite of risperidone; extended-release tablet (do NOT crush/chew); LAI formulations for adherence

canadian_clinical.starting_dose: Oral: 6 mg once daily; LAI: Initiation per product monograph
canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Oral: Adjust by 3 mg every â‰¥5 days; LAI: Standard loading regimen
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: Oral: 12 mg/day; some use 15 mg off-label
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Oral: Start 6 mg AM; can increase to 9-12 mg within 1 week if tolerated
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Oral: 3-6 mg AM; LAI preferred for maintenance to ensure adherence

warnings: Black box warning: Increased mortality in elderly with dementia-related psychosis
EPS and tardive dyskinesia risk (similar to risperidone)
Hyperprolactinemia (dose-dependent) - can cause galactorrhea, amenorrhea, sexual dysfunction
QTc prolongation - use caution with other QTc-prolonging agents
Metabolic effects: weight gain, hyperglycemia, dyslipidemia (moderate risk)
Do NOT crush or chew ER tablets - will cause dose dumping
Renally eliminated - dose adjustment required in renal impairment

cautions.renal: CrCl 50-79: Max 6 mg/day; CrCl 10-49: Max 3 mg/day; CrCl <10: Not recommended; LAI formulations contraindicated if CrCl <50
cautions.hepatic: No adjustment needed for mild-moderate; use caution in severe
cautions.pregnancy: Pregnancy Category C; crosses placenta; neonatal EPS risk
